Titles: Synthesis of arctic SAR Sea-Ice image using patch-adapted splicing
Source title: Yi Qi Yi Biao Xue Bao/Chinese Journal of Scientific Instrument
Abstract: Aiming at the difficulty in obtaining arctic SAR sea-ice ground-truth data, we propose a novel algorithm to synthesize the arctic SAR sea-ice imagery and its ground-truth map. By fully utilizing the correlation between SAR image patches, the synthesized sea-ice imagery can not only successfully preserve the non-homogeneous textures and multi-scale structural characteristics, but also approach more realistic-looking SAR sea-ice imagery. Based on region-based posterior sampling, the algorithm first adaptively selects the synthesis region size according to the similarity between image patches and obtains the best matching patches; then, the minimum error boundary cut path at the boundary of adjacent patches is calculated to achieve seamless splicing and eliminate artificial defects. The experiments on real SAR sea-ice imagery indicate that compared with existing algorithms the proposed algorithm can synthesize more natural SAR sea-ice imagery and ground-truth map. The synthesized images have a positive significance to the evaluation of arctic SAR sea-ice image segmentation and classification algorithm.
